meanings.definition: Able to be doubted or questioned.
meanings.sent1: The story's details were doubtable, so I wasn't sure if it was true.
meanings.sent2: It is natural to find some information doubtable until it is confirmed.
meanings.sent3: The detective found the suspect's alibi doubtable and decided to investigate further.
meanings.sent4: Her promises were as doubtable as a mirage in the desert.
meanings.sent5: The teacher's explanation was so doubtable that even the students had doubts.

meanings.sent1: The doubtable character in the movie kept the audience guessing until the end.
meanings.sent2: The witness's testimony was doubtable due to inconsistencies.
meanings.sent3: The cat's innocent look was doubtable after finding a torn pillow.
meanings.sent4: The old house had a doubtable history of ghost sightings.
meanings.sent5: The stranger's intentions seemed doubtable, so I decided to be cautious.
